what_this_means.easy: This shows where your files are stored and how much space they use. The bigger sections use more storage.
what_this_means.standard: Your file distribution across providers. Large files and duplicates are the biggest opportunities for savings.
what_this_means.pro: Complete storage analysis with provider utilization, file type distribution, and optimization opportunities.

duplicates.title: Duplicate Files
duplicates.subtitle: Files that exist in multiple places

what_this_means.easy: These are the same files stored in multiple places. You can safely remove the extras to save money.
what_this_means.standard: Duplicate clusters ranked by storage savings. We recommend keeping files on the cheapest provider.
what_this_means.pro: Hash-based deduplication analysis with provider cost optimization and conflict resolution strategies.

what_this_means.easy: This shows how much you're paying each month for storage. Higher bars mean higher costs.
what_this_means.standard: Current monthly costs based on usage and provider pricing. Consolidation can reduce total spend.
what_this_means.pro: Detailed cost analysis including base plans, overage charges, and optimization opportunities by provider tier.

actions.cold_storage_description: Move large, old files to cheaper archive storage
actions.consolidation_description: Combine scattered files into a single provider

glossary.duplicate: Two or more files that are exactly the same.
glossary.cold_files: Files you haven't opened in a long time.
glossary.archive_tier: Cheaper storage meant for files you rarely use.
glossary.provider: A cloud storage service like Google Drive or Dropbox.
glossary.cluster: A group of duplicate files that share the same content.
glossary.hash: A unique fingerprint that identifies file content.
glossary.overage: Extra storage costs beyond your plan's included amount.
